oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Performance - Eddie Bayers - 2017-05-21
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Musician spotlight program featuring Eddie Bayers from the Ford Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on May 21, 2017. Includes appearances by Lane Brody, Steve Gibson and Mike Snider and band.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Eddie Bayers; Lane Brody; Steve Gibson; Mike Snider;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Walk-in music / (00:58) Opening comments by Abigail St. Pierre / (01:56) More walk-in music / (04:04) Opening of program and introduction of Eddie Bayers by Abigail St. Pierre / (06:48) Opening comments by Eddie Bayers / (08:00) Eddie talks about drums in country music and introduces family members in the audience / (10:31) Introduction of Lane Brody / (13:59) Opening comments by Lane / (14:34) Performs the Yellow Rose Of Texas (Lane Brody-vocal/Tom Flora-harmony vocal) / (18:02) Eddie talks more about the evolution of drums in recording studios in Nashville and drummer Buddy Harman / (20:00) Introduction of Steve Gibson / (21:47) Steve talks about his time working with Eddie and introduces the next song performance / (24:24) Performs unidentified song (Eddie Bayers-hand drum/Steve Gibson-guitar) / (25:34) Eddie and Steve tells story about Los Angeles record producer and Randy Travis recording session /

(27:53) Eddie tells story about producer who would refuse to do more than what was minimally necessary / (30:03) Eddie talks about working for Steve Gibson and being a member of the Grand Ole Opry house band / (31:48) Eddie talks about being a team player and introduces Mike Snider and his band consisting of Jake Stargel, Sterling Abernathy, Todd Cook, Brian Christianson / (38:20) Performs Battle Cry of Freedom/Arkansas Traveler (Mike Snider and band with Eddie Bayers) / (42:22) Eddie talks about Mike Snider / (42:54) Mike tells a couple of jokes / (46:55) Introduces the next song / (47:57) Performs Tennessee Rhapsody and Old Grimes (Mike Snider and band with Eddie Bayers) / (52:38) Mike tells Cracker Barrel jokes / (56:30) Performs Moving Out (Mike Snider and band with Eddie Bayers) / (59:30) Closing comments by Eddie Bayers and final curtain calls / (01:01:39) Walk-out music / (01:28:13) FILE END.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Bayers, Eddie (Drummer); Gibson, Steve (Guitarist); Brody, Lane; Snider, Mike; Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.);
